title: Low FPS on not-bad laptop
body:
Hi, I used to have ~100 fps on low settings, now I get like 20-30 while being on lane (MAX).
Let me introduce my specs:
CPU: Intel Core I7 2,2GHZ + 2,2GHZ 
RAM 6GB
64 bit win 7
GPU: Intel HD 4000 (When I use nVIDIA 540m, it works pretty well, but card is broken, cannot use it, still, it used to work on INTEL HD 4000 )
DRIVE: SSD (brand new)
I add DXDIAG.txt so you can see what's inside my gear. (It's mostly in English, some Polish parts might be there, but I think It won't be a problem).
 I posted DXDIAG on some upload webside   (if it's suspicious, and it can be, please inform me how to add files to post directly).
I followed optymalization steps (found some big post on forum), but still can't play. What causes that? I literally optymalized EVERYTHING.
There must me some other problem, dunno where, I would really apreciate any help.

replies.body:
Most FPS problems are caused by display driver issues, windows power settings, or corrupt/missing game assets. As a first step, I recommend working through our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting), as we've consolidated the most common solutions there.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.
